general_texts:
Whittier College may accept a maximum of 90 semester credits in transfer, 70 of which may be taken at the community college level. To be eligible for transfer, courses must be completed with a final grade of C- or higher. Courses accepted in transfer will be accepted with a grade of "TR" indicating transfer credit. Letter grades will not transfer.


﻿Whittier College does not require completion of any minimum number of units or courses before students are eligible to transfer. However, listed below are the lower division major requirements that students are able to complete at the community college level. Any upper division requirements listed are for planning purposes but are not requirements to complete prior to transfer.


We honor the Associate Degree for Transfer (ADT) Commitment with all accredited California Community Colleges. A California Community College student who has earned the ADT (AA-T or AS-T) will have guaranteed admission and junior standing based on the following criteria:


  • The student must submit an application and complete all application requirements.
  • The student will have completed all IGETC or CSU GE-Breadth coursework with a grade of C- or better.
  • The student will have completed at least 60 transferable units with a grade of C- or better.
  • The student acknowledges that if a grade of D+ or below is earned in a transferable course, and they did not retake the course for a higher grade, that course will not be accepted for transfer credit, but will still be factored into the cumulative transfer grade point average.
  • We will honor academic renewal from community college partners prior to matriculation into Whittier College.
  • Proof of completion of the Associates Degree is required as are all IGETC or CSU GE-Breadth Certifications and official college transcripts.

university_course.title: Introduction to Applied Elementary Linear Algebra

English majors select one of three areas of emphasis, each with its own specific requirements.

  • Major in English with an Emphasis in Literature
  • Major in English with an Emphasis in Creative Writing
  • Major in English with an Emphasis in Applied Media Studies
